title: Limnomedusa macroglossa
text:
Limnomedusa macroglossa (common name: rapids frog) is a species of <a href="frog">frog</a> in the family <a href="Alsodidae">Alsodidae</a>, in the <a href="monotypic">monotypic</a> genus Limnomedusa. It is found in southern <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>, northeastern <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>, <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a>, and northern <a href="Paraguay">Paraguay</a>.
"Limnomedusa macroglossa" are found in open and forested areas on rocky soil along rivers. Tadpoles are found in temporary river-side pools and slow-flowing water.
It is threatened by <a href="habitat%20degradation">habitat degradation</a> due to agricultural activities, water pollution, hydroelectric development, and pine plantations. For example, the <a href="Itaipu%20Dam">Itaipu Dam</a> destroyed populations in <a href="Paran%C3%A1%20%28state%29">Paraná</a>.
